title: Alpecin-Fenix and Van der Poel withdraw from UAE Tour due to positive COVID-19 test
content:
Alpecin-Fenix will not start stage 2 of the UAE Tour after a staff member tested positive for coronavirus. Mathieu van der Poel, who won the first stage of the tour, would have worn the leader’s jersey into the stage 2 time trial.

Testing was conducted on the evening of the first stage. The UAE Tour released a statement saying that the member of staff who tested positive was immediately isolated, as were those who came into close contact with them.

ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡ª #UAETour

We can confirm that we have withdrawn from the race.

More information will be given soon. The wellbeing of everyone involved is our main concern.

â€” Alpecin-Fenix Cycling Team (@AlpecinFenix) February 22, 2021

David Dekker (Team Jumbo-Visma), who placed second on the opening stage, will start stage 2 as the leader in the general classification.

This story is ongoing.

The post Alpecin-Fenix and Van der Poel withdraw from UAE Tour due to positive COVID-19 test appeared first on CyclingTips.
author: Abby Mickey
